data.title: Monique Coleman bio: Age, net worth, husband, movies and TV shows
data.meta_description: MONIQUE COLEMAN is an American actress, singer, entrepreneur, and philanthropist. Check out this article to know more about her age, husband, worth and career.
data.text:
Adrienne Monique Coleman is an American-born entrepreneur, singer, dancer, philanthropist, and actress. Her career is best defined by her role as Taylor McKessie in Disney's High School Musical. She has also worked with the United Nations as a Youth Champion for the international year of youth, where she raises awareness on the challenges facing young people worldwide.

Monique can be best described as a jack of all trades due to the overwhelming success she enjoys in almost everything she touches.

Monique Coleman profile summary

Full name: Adrienne Monique Coleman

Date of birth: November 13, 1980

Place of birth: Orangeburg, South Carolina, United States

Monique Coleman age: 40 years (as of 2020)

Nationality: American

Height: 5' 2½" (1.59 m)

Relationship status: Married

Spouse: Walter Jordan

Profession: Actress, singer, entrepreneur, dancer, philanthropist

Net worth: $2 million

Monique Coleman bio

Monique Coleman was born on November 13, 1980, in Orangeburg, South Carolina. How old is Monique Coleman? The super-talented actress is 40 years old as of 2020. She has not offered any information about her parents and siblings.

Education

The actress studied at Heathwood Hall Episcopal School. She later joined the Theatre School at DePaul University in Chicago. She earned her BFA in Acting in 2002.

Career

Her acting career started way back when she was a young girl acting in theatres. Her first significant break was while at an acting class where she was booked for her first commercial.

This breakthrough became pivotal in shaping what she was going to do next as an actress in the southeast region and later in her career.

In 2006, Coleman’s career began advancing as she appeared in the first High School Musical movie as Taylor McKessie. The Taylor High School Musical role was her major career breakthrough.

Monique Coleman movies and TV shows

Monique’s career has been characterized by progressive success. From Monique Coleman High School Musical she has grown to feature in other movie projects and television shows as follows:

1995: Mother of the River - Short-Film

1997: The Ditchdigger's Daughters - TV Movie

2005: The Reading Room - TV Movie

2006: On-Line Short-Film

2006: High School Musical - TV Movie

2007: High School Musical 2 - TV Movie

2008: High School Musical 3: Senior Year - Video Short

2010: Promise Rings as Veronica Baylerd

2010: We Are Family - Post-production

2014: Free the N*pple as Roz

2015: Naomi and Ely's No Kiss List as Girl-Robin

2017: Distortion - Short-Film; Post-Production

2017: The Outdoorsman as Jen

2018: Broken Star - Annie

2019: Witness Infection as Rose

2019: Real.Live.Girl as Sam - Short Film

2020: Steppin' Back To Love as April - TV Movie; Main Role

2020: Phobias – completed

2020: The F*** happened – completed

Achievements and awards

Monique Coleman has accomplished so much. Her career has been decorated with numerous achievements and awards as follows:

1998: Young Artist Award for Best Performance in a TV Movie or Feature Film - Young Ensemble (Nominated)

2006: Character and Morality in Entertainment Awards (Camie) for her role in The Reading Room (Won)

2019: Daytime Emmy Awards: Outstanding Host for a Lifestyle, Children's or Special Class Program (Nominated)

Monique Coleman husband

The actress is married to the love of her life, Walter Jordan. Monique Coleman and husband tied the knot on February 14, 2012.

Body measurements

Coleman measures 36-26-35 inches for her bust, waist and hips respectively. Her height is 5' 2½" and she weighs 48kgs.

Monique Coleman natural hair has also made her stand out, enhancing her already sparkling dark brown eyes and smooth brown complexion.

Monique Coleman net worth

Coleman is estimated to have a net worth of around $2 million. Most of her earnings are from her career as an actress. She has also made money from dancing, entrepreneurship, and endorsements.

Monique Coleman is the true definition of greatness. From acting in theatres to performing in top-rated television shows and movies, there's no doubt her journey has been a successful one.
